PerceptionSystemClassName: Class that will be used to spawn the perception system, can be game-specific
HotSpotManagerClassName: Class that will be used to spawn the hot spot manager, can be game-specific
EnvQueryManagerClassName: Class that will be used to spawn the env query manager, can be game-specific
AcceptanceRadius:
Default AI movement's acceptance radius used to determine whether
AI reached path's end
PathfollowingRegularPathPointAcceptanceR:
Value used for pathfollowing's internal code to determine whether AI reached path's point.
    @note this value is not used for path's last point. @see AcceptanceRadius
PathfollowingNavLinkAcceptanceRadius:
Similarly to PathfollowingRegularPathPointAcceptanceRadius used by pathfollowing's internals
    but gets applied only when next point on a path represents a begining of navigation link
bFinishMoveOnGoalOverlap: If true, overlapping the goal will be counted by default as finishing a move
bAcceptPartialPaths: Sets default value for rather move tasks accept partial paths or not
bAllowStrafing: Sets default value for rather move tasks allow strafing or not
bAllowControllersAsEQSQuerier:
if enable will make EQS not complaint about using Controllers as queriers. Default behavior (false) will
    in places automatically convert controllers to pawns, and complain if code user bypasses the conversion or uses
    pawn-less controller
bEnableDebuggerPlugin: if set, GameplayDebuggerPlugin will be loaded on module's startup
bForgetStaleActors:
If set, actors will be forgotten by the perception system when their stimulus has expired.
    If not set, the perception system will remember the actor even if they are no longer perceived and their
    stimuli has exceeded its max age
bAddBlackboardSelfKey:
If set to true will result in automatically adding the SelfActor key to new Blackboard assets. It will
    also result in making sure all the BB assets loaded do have the SelfKey entry, via PostLoad
bBlackboardKeyDecoratorAllowsNoneAsValue: If enabled, blackboard based decorators will set key to 'Invalid' on creation or when selected key no longer exists (instead of using the first key of the blackboard).
DefaultBlackboard: If set, new BTs will use this BB as default.
DefaultSightCollisionChannel: Which collision channel to use for sight checks by default
